result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent James Thalman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Vincent James Thalman was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent James Thalman is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Vincent James Thalman was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Vincent James Thalman was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharges, the domestic violence surcharge and the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA samlpe, his voting rights are suspended; and he may never possess firearms.

records.addlTxt: Count three.
Count one.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 27 months in the Wisconsin State Prison with credit for 150 days served.  Court ordered 13 months Initial Term Of Confinement and 14 months Extended Supervision.


As to Count 3:
Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.

As a condition of extended supervision, the Court ordered the Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and the DNA surcharge. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.


Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledment, and Victim Impact Statement.
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Witness fee request prepared for Theresa T. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's Motion to Adjourn Jury trial is withdrawn, witness is now available.
Parties are prepared to proceed to trial today.  State's offer is withdrawn.  
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:20am.  
TWELVE (12) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 10:55am.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state; defense defers opening statement until the close of state's case.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Theresa T,; PO Bradley Summers, Cudahy PD  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for dismissal at close of state's case denied by the court.  Colloquy between the court and defendant as to his choice to testify in his own behalf.  Court finds it to be a free and voluntary decision. Jury in the box.  Court released jury for lunch and directed jurors not to conduct any independent investigation and to return by 2pm.
Court places jury instructions that will be read to the jury on the record.
Jury in the box at 2:25pm.  Stipulation read to the jury. Defense counsel is waiving an opening statement.  Sworn for defense: Vincent T.  Jury out of the box at 2:37pm.  Jury in the box at 2:40pm  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: PO Summers.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Rebuttal by the state.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:30pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Lee and Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Defense motion to dismiss without further argument is denied.
At the hour of 3:47pm the jury reached their verdicts and at 3:55pm returned to the courtroom and, by their foreperson(#12), brought in the following verdicts
Count 1:  We, the jury find the defendant GUILTY of Bail Jumping
Count 2:  We, the jury find the defendant NOT GUILTY of Battery
Count 3:  We, the jury find the defendant GUILTY of Disorderly Conduct.
Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to counts 1 and 3 and granted defense motion for acquittal as to count 2.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms or body armor and his civil rights are suspended until they are restored.  Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 9-9-2015 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Brian Hagner was also present in court.
Attorney Thornton informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  

New defense counsel, Attorney Brian Hagner, will be unavailable on 8-12-2015, which is the current date now set for Jury Trial, and defendant does not wish to waive Speedy Trial.   Court ordered Jury Trial adjourned to Branch 38 on 8-26-2015 at 8:15 am.  Because the new trial date is one day outside of the Speedy Trial demand, Court will stay the speedy trial date for the one day.   mld
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record from defense counsel, received and filed.   mld

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 38.  All parties notified as of August 3, 2015  this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner,  Branch 38, in Room 502 of the Courthouse.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, Defendant Vincent James Thalman not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Speedy trial demand entered.  All parties notified as of August 3, 2015  this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner,  Branch 38, in Room 502 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests, absolute sobriety, no possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Absolutely No Release From Home (24 hour curfew).  Release for legal contacts and Court out of County if verified.   mld

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Vincent James Thalman not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  The Court ordered gps supervision as a condition of bail.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-27-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Order Appointment Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Copy of order given to Attorney Thornton.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived preliminary hearing.  Signed Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver signed and filed.  Court bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed.  Defense waives reading of the Information and enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion for modification of bail heard and denied.  Cash bail to remain at $1,000.00 with TOT Justice Point.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Indigency hearing conducted.   Court finds defendant qualifies for representation at county expense.  Court appoints Attorney Dennis Thornton.  Telephone call to Dennis Thornton who accepts appointment.  Matter set for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to ADA assignment case is transfered to branch 04, Judge Flanagan.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Theresa T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vincent James Thalman in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  Defendant Vincent James Thalman in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 2 and 3 ( Misdemeanor).
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.    
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
